terrain_types.name: Linear
terrain_types.description: Any wide feature that a miniature cannot generally be placed on top of.
rules: Blocks Line of Sight up to 3" after crossing

terrain_types.name: Area
terrain_types.description: Features that cover a space on the table and can have miniatures placed within them.
rules: Blocks Line of Sight up to 3" into the feature

terrain_types.name: Field
terrain_types.description: Similar to an Area feature, but ground level.
rules: May be designated as Difficult or Impassable

terrain_types.name: Individual
terrain_types.description: A single piece of terrain that a figure cannot climb.
rules: Blocks Line of Sight up to 3" after crossing

terrain_types.name: Block
terrain_types.description: A terrain piece that can be climbed or otherwise interacted with, but which figures cannot enter.
rules: Provides Cover if in contact with corner

terrain_types.name: Interior
terrain_types.description: An enclosed terrain piece that figures can enter.

notable_features.feature: Large structure or facility
Cluster of industrial items such as barrels, machinery, or similar
Open space surrounded by fencing, barricades, or low walls
Landing pad, loading bay, or similar open space with some scatter terrain
Cargo area with containers, crates, civilian vehicles, or similar
Single large structure or two medium structures

regular_features.feature: Linear obstacles such as a fences, railings, or barricades
Building
Open ground with a few incidental items (sign post, boulder, or similar)
Several pieces of spread-out scatter terrain, such as boulders, barrels, vehicle parts, or similar
Open ground with a single central piece such as a statue, tree, or similar
Industrial or urban terrain such as shipping containers, a cluster of barrels, or a large civilian vehicle

notable_features.feature: Forested hill or high ground
Large, difficult-to-cross feature such as a swamp
Group of rock formations
Forested area with paths to traverse
Large but fairly bare hill
Single building, ruin, or similar

regular_features.feature: Difficult to pass feature such as swamp or dense forest
Rock formation surrounded by plants
Cluster of plants
Rock formation
Open space with scattered single plants
Natural linear feature such as a hedgerow or line of trees

notable_features.feature: Scatter terrain with plants mixed in
Large pile of rubble and debris
Large, ruined building, possibly multi-story
Remnants of a landing pad or town plaza, but overgrown with plants
Ruined tower surrounded by rubble
Large statue surrounded by plants or rubble

regular_features.feature: Odd feature such as crystals, weird plants, or similar
Ruined single building
Partial ruin (such as half of a building surrounded by rubble)
Open space with a few items of scatter
Strange statue or vehicle wreck
Scattered plants with some rubble

notable_features.feature: Structure with damage (or reduced to a heap of rubble)
Cluster of natural features (rocks, plants) with wreckage among them
Forested area on fire
Pile of wreckage
Large chunk of wreckage in crater
Large crater

regular_features.feature: Open with scatter. Mixture of natural features and wreckage.
Scattered bits of wreckage
Larger piece of wreckage
Crater
Natural feature (rocks, plants, hedgerow)
Open ground, with smoke from fire

line_of_sight: Lines of Sight are stopped 3" after crossing the boundary of an Area feature
Lines of Sight are stopped 3" after crossing a Linear, Individual or Block feature
Lines of Sight are stopped 3" into an Area feature, even if the boundary was not crossed
Lines of Sight are stopped if it crosses or is partially obscured by another figure
Ignore terrain features within 1" of the firer for Line of Sight purposes
cover: A figure is in Cover if Line of Sight crossed any terrain feature
A figure is in Cover if positioned within an Area feature
A figure is in Cover if in contact with the corner of Block terrain
movement: Climbing through a window or hole costs 2"
Figures moving on the ground cannot move directly through another figure at any time
Difficult terrain consumes an additional 1" of movement allowance for every full 2" moved in it
Enemies are not affected by Difficult terrain and move at full speed through such features
Vertical obstacles can be traversed by paying the cost in inches
A descent equal to the height of the figure or less can be performed for free
Jumping down 3" or further inflicts a Damage 0 hit
Troopers may not jump down from a height exceeding 6"
